name: ECON 120
title: Development Economics
description: Studies the microeconomics of development. Topics may include health and nutrition, education, intra-household economics, formal and informal risk-coping mechanisms, savings, credit, agriculture, institutions, and service delivery and corruption. Focuses on empirical methods. Problem sets require statistical software such as Stata. (Formerly Economic Development.)
class_notes: Enrollment in and attendance of secondary sections is strongly encouraged for student success in this course.
